It extends the provisions, which facilitate public participation in legal proceedings if, and when live links are used while protecting those proceedings from unauthorised recordings or transmission (Part 2 of Schedule 27).

title: The Coronavirus Act 2020 (Registration of Deaths and Still-Births) (Extension) (No.2) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Student Fees (Inflation Index) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: Article 4(12) of the 2005 Order enables the Department to specify an index of prices to which it must have regard in deciding whether any increase in the basic and higher tuition fee amounts is no greater than required to maintain the value of the amounts in real terms as specified under.

title: The Marine Protected Areas (Prohibited Methods of Fishing) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations make minor corrections to two coordinates which provide for the Maidens Special Area of Conservation in Schedule 8 to the Marine Protected Areas (Prohibited Methods of Fishing) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2022.

title: The Recovery of Health Services Charges (Amounts) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: The Recovery of Health Services Charges (Northern Ireland) Order 2006 provides for a scheme for the recovery of charges in cases where an injured person who receives a compensation payment in respect of his injury has received hospital treatment or ambulance services. The charges are specified in certificates issued by the Department for Communities and are payable by persons who pay compensation to the injured person. The charges in each case are calculated by reference to a tariff of charges provided for by the Recovery of Health Services Charges (Amounts) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006 (“the principal Regulations”).

title: The Firefighters’ Pensions (Remediable Service) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: The Public Service Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2014 (c. 2) (“PSPA(NI) 2014”) makes provision, and confers powers to make further provision (in the form of “scheme regulations” as defined in section 1 of PSPA(NI) 2014) about the establishment of public service pension schemes. The Firefighters’ Pension Scheme Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 (S.R. 2015 No. 78) (“the 2015 Regulations”) are the scheme regulations establishing the successor firefighters’ pension scheme (“the reformed scheme”) to the schemes established by the Firefighters’ Pension Scheme Order (Northern Ireland) 2007 (S.R. 2007 No. 144) and the New Firefighters’ Pension Scheme Order (Northern Ireland) 2007 (S.R. 2007 No. 215) (“the legacy schemes”). The 2015 Regulations provided for transitional protection for certain cohorts of legacy scheme members. Transitional protection of this sort was subsequently found to unlawfully discriminate between legacy scheme members on the basis of age.

title: The Health and Social Care Pension Schemes (Remediable Service) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: The Public Service Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2014 (“the 2014 Act”) makes provision and confers powers to make further provision (in the form of “scheme regulations” as defined in chapter 2 of the 2014 Act), about the establishment of public service pension schemes. There are two Health and Social Care Pension Schemes: a scheme divided into two sections known as the 1995 Section, established by the Health and Social Services (Superannuation) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1995(S.R. 1995 No. 95) (“the 1995 Regulations”), and the 2008 Section, established by the Health and Social Care (Pension Scheme) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008 (S.R. 2008 No. 256) (“the 2008 Regulations) (together “the legacy scheme”), and the scheme established by the Health and Social Care Pension Scheme Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 (S.R. 2015 No. 120) (“the 2015 scheme”). The Health and Social Care Pension Scheme (Transitional and Consequential Provisions) Regulations (Northern Ireland)  (S.R. No. 122) (“the 2015 Transitional Regulations”) provided for the treatment and payment of legacy scheme benefits to certain members of the 2015 scheme. Transitional protection of this kind provided when reformed public service pensions were introduced in 2015 was found to discriminate against public service pension scheme members on the basis of age.

title: The Teachers’ Pension Scheme (Remediable Service) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: The Public Service Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2014 (c. 2) (“PSPA (NI) 2014”) makes provision, and confers powers to make further provision (in the form of “scheme regulations” as defined in section 1 of PSPA 2014), about the establishment of public service pension schemes. The Teachers’ Pension Scheme Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2014 (S.R. 2014/310) (“the 2014 Regulations”) are the scheme regulations establishing the successor teacher pension scheme (“the reformed scheme”) to the scheme established by the Teachers’ Superannuation Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1998 (S.R. 1998/333) (“the legacy scheme”). The 2014 Regulations provided for transitional protection for certain cohorts of legacy scheme members. This transitional protection was subsequently found to unlawfully discriminate between teacher pension scheme members on the basis of age.

title: The Motor Vehicle Testing (Amendment) (Fees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Motor Vehicle Testing Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 by increasing most of the fees payable for examinations, re-examinations and appeals as follows—Examinations, re-examinations and appeals under regulations 7(2), 11(3) and 16(1)—for vehicles in Classes I or II from £22.00 to £34.00;for vehicles in Classes III or IV from £30.50 to £38.00;for vehicles in Class V, from £41.50 to £70.50;for vehicles in Class VA—with 13 to 16 seats, exclusive of the driver, from £53.50 to £82.50;with 17 to 35 seats, exclusive of the driver, from £65.00 to £94.00;with more than 35 seats, exclusive of the driver, from £81.00 to £110.00;for vehicles in Class VI, from £41.50 to £70.50; andfor vehicles in Class VIA, from £53.50 to £82.50.Re-examination made within 21 days of the issue of the notice of refusal under regulation 11(4)—for vehicles in Classes I or II from £14.00 to £29.50;for vehicles in Classes III or IV from £18.50 to £29.50;for vehicles in Class V from £19.50 to £38.00;for vehicles in Class VA—with 13 to 16 seats, exclusive of the driver, from £19.50 to £38.00;with 17 to 35 seats, exclusive of the driver, from £32.00 to £38.00;with more than 35 seats, exclusive of the driver, from £44.00 to £38.00; andfor vehicles in Class VI from £19.50 to £38.00; andfor vehicles in Class VIA from £19.50 to £38.00.Re-examination made within 21 days of the issue of notice of refusal under regulation 11(5)—vehicles in Class VA—with 13 to 16 seats, exclusive of the driver, from £19.50 to £38.00;with 17 to 35 seats, exclusive of the driver, from £32.00 to £38.00;with more than 35 seats, exclusive of the driver, from £44.00 to £38.00; andvehicles in Class VIA from £19.50 to £38.00.Fees payable for a full examination under Article 81 of the Road Traffic (Northern Ireland) Order 1995 (“the Order”) have changed—for vehicles in Classes I or II from £22.00 to £34.00;for vehicles in Classes III or IV from £30.50 to £38.00;for vehicles in Class V, from £41.50 to £70.50;for vehicles in Class VA—with 13 to 16 seats, exclusive of the driver, from £53.50 to £82.50;with 17 to 35 seats, exclusive of the driver, from £65.00 to £94.00;with more than 35 seats, exclusive of the driver, from £81.00 to £110.00;for vehicles in Class VI, from £41.50 to £70.50;for vehicles in Class VIA, from £53.50 to £82.50;for Public service vehicles (not being a taxi), from £83.00 to £102.50;for Taxis, from £122.00 to £147.00;for Goods vehicles of 3,500 kg maximum gross weight or under from £30.50 to £38.00;for Goods vehicles over 3,500 kg gross weight—2 axle rigid vehicle from £37.50 to £101.00;3 axle rigid vehicle from £48.50 to £109.00;4 axle rigid vehicle from £60.00 to £117.50;articulated vehicle having a 2 axle drawing vehicle from £42.00 to £101.00; andarticulated vehicle having a 3 or more axle drawing vehicle from £55.00 to £109.00;for trailers—for a 1 axle trailer from £35.00 to £86.50;for a 2 axle trailer from £36.00 to £86.50; andfor a 3 axle trailer from £37.00 to £86.50.Fees payable for a test under Article 75(5), or a partial inspection under Article 81 of the Order have increased—for vehicles in Classes I or II from £14.00 to £29.50;for vehicles in Classes III or IV from £18.50 to £29.50;for vehicles in Class V from £19.50 to £38.00;for vehicles in Class VI from £19.50 to £38.00;for Public service vehicles (not being a taxi) from £19.50 to £38.00;for Taxis from £19.50 to £29.50;for Goods vehicles of 3,500 kg maximum gross weight or under from £18.50 to £29.50;for Goods vehicles over 3,500 kg maximum gross weight from £18.50 to £38.00;for articulated vehicles from £19.50 to £38.00; andfor Trailers from £19.50 to £38.00.The fee payable for a duplicate test certificate for any vehicle remains unchanged at £10.00.

title: The Public Service Vehicles Accessibility (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Public Service Vehicles Accessibility Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 in order to increase the fees payable in respect of applications for accessibility certificates.

title: The Taxi Licensing (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend Schedule 1 to the Taxi Licensing Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 to increase fees payable as follows—Application for a taxi licence fee increased from £138.50 to £147.00; andFurther application for a taxi licence within 21 days increased from £19.50 to £29.50.

title: The Taxis (Taximeters, Devices and Maximum Fares) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Taxis (Taximeters, Devices and Maximum Fares) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 in order to increase the fee payable for the inspection, testing and sealing of an approved taximeter and device from £35.00 to £42.00.

title: The Goods Vehicles (Testing) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend Part I and II of Schedule 1 to the Goods Vehicles (Testing) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 to increase the fees payable as follows—For light goods vehicles 3,500 kilograms or less £30.50 to £38.00For vehicles exceeding 3,500 kilograms maximum gross weight or more—The fee payable on application for a first test, periodical test or an appeal is increased—for a 2 axle rigid vehicle from £76.00 to £101.00;for a 3 axle rigid vehicle from £87.00 to £109.00;for a 4 axle rigid vehicle from £98.50 to £117.50;for an articulated vehicle having a 2 axle drawing vehicle, from £80.50 to £101.00; andfor an articulated vehicle having a 3 or more axle drawing vehicle, from £93.50 to £109.00For trailers—The fee payable on application for a first test, a periodical test, or an appeal is increased—For a 1 axle trailer, from £50.00 to £86.50;For a 2 axle trailer, from £51.00 to £86.50; andFor a 3 axle trailer, from £52.00 to £86.50.The fees for retests—For light goods vehicles 3,500 kilograms or less £18.50 to £29.50;For vehicles exceeding 3,500 kilograms maximum gross weight or more £18.50 to £38.00;Articulated drawing vehicle £19.50 to £38.00; andTrailers £19.50 to £38.00.

title: The Public Service Vehicles (Licence Fees) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Public Service Vehicles Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1985 in order to amend the fees payable in respect of applications for public service vehicle licences.

title: The Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) (Amendment) (Test Fees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996 by substituting a new Schedule 4.

title: The Taxi Drivers’ Licences (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Taxi Drivers’ Licences Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2014 in order to increase the fee for a practical test of competence to drive a taxi from £60.00 to £70.00 where a test commences at any time between 8.30am and 4.30pm during the days Monday to Friday and from £90.00 to £109.00 where a test commences at any other time.

title: The Police Pensions (Remediable Service) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: The Public Service Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2014 (c. 2) (“the 2014 Act”) makes provision, and confers powers to make further provision (in the form of “scheme regulations” as defined in section 1 of the 2014 Act), about the establishment of public service pension schemes. The Police Pensions Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 (S.R. 2015 No. 113) (“the 2015 Regulations”) are the scheme regulations establishing the successor police pension scheme (“the reformed scheme”) to the schemes established by the Royal Ulster Constabulary Pensions Regulations 1988 (S.R. 1988 No. 374) and the Police Pension (Northern Ireland) Regulations 2009 (S.R. 2009 No. 79) (“the legacy schemes”). The 2015 Regulations provided for transitional protection for certain cohorts of legacy scheme members. Transitional protection of this sort was subsequently found to unlawfully discriminate between legacy scheme members on the basis of age.

title: The Social Security (Infected Blood Capital Disregard) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: Regulation 2 of these Regulations amends—the Income Support (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987,the Jobseeker’s Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996,the State Pension Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003,the Housing Benefit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006,the Housing Benefit (Persons who have attained the qualifying age for state pension credit) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006, andthe Employment and Support Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008.

title: The Occupational Pension Schemes (Collective Money Purchase Schemes) (No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Pension Protection Fund and Occupational Pension Schemes (Levy Ceiling) (No. 2) Order 2023 (revoked)
The Pension Protection Fund and Occupational Pension Schemes (Levy Ceiling) Order 2023 (revoked)
The Grading Inspection of Certified Tourist Establishments (Fees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations are made under Article 20(1)(b) of The Tourism (Northern Ireland) Order 1992. They prescribe the manner of calculating the fee payable to the Northern Ireland Tourist Board by the proprietor of a certified tourist establishment who has requested a grading inspection of that establishment be conducted by an officer of the Board.

title: The Pensions Dashboards (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Public Service Pension Schemes (Rectification of Unlawful Discrimination) (Tax) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations make modifications for the purposes of applying the correct tax treatment to public service pension schemes which are affected by the rectification of discrimination provisions contained in the Public Service Pensions and Judicial Offices Act 2022 (c. 7) (“PSPJOA 2022”). Modifications are made to enactments in their application in relation to a relevant person under the authority of section 11(2) and (3) of the Finance Act 2022 (c. 3). Authority for the retrospective effect of certain modifications made by these Regulations is provided for by section 11(4)(a) of the Finance Act 2022.

title: The Child Support Fees (Revocation) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Welfare Reform (Northern Ireland) Order 2015 (Commencement No. 17) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order brings into operation provisions in the Welfare Reform (Northern Ireland) Order 2015.

title: The Judicial Pensions (Remediable Service etc.) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: The Public Service Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2014 (c. 2) (“PSPA 2014”) makes provision, and confers powers to make further provision (in the form of “scheme regulations” as defined in section 1 of PSPA 2014), about the establishment of public service pension schemes. The Judicial Pensions Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 (S.R. 2015 No. 76) (“the 2015 Regulations”) are the scheme regulations establishing the successor judicial pension scheme (“the 2015 scheme”) to the judicial legacy schemes (as defined in section 70(3) of the Public Service and Pensions and Judicial Offices Act 2022 (c.7) (“PSPJOA 2022”)). The 2015 Regulations provided for transitional protection for certain cohorts of judicial legacy scheme members. This transitional protection was subsequently found to unlawfully discriminate between judicial pension scheme members on the basis of age.

title: The Packaging Waste (Data Reporting) (No. 2) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations are made to correct errors in The Packaging Waste (Data Reporting) (No.2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (S.R. 2023 No. 25) (“the first Regulations”), to make further provision clarifying when a brand owner is a producer in relation to packaging and to assign responsibility for certain packaging to packer/fillers, rather than brand owners, and to importers.

title: The Period Products (Free Provision) (2022 Act) (Commencement No.1) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order appoints 26th June 2023 as the day for the coming into operation of section 1(4) and (9) of the Period Products (Free Provision) Act (Northern Ireland) 2022, which provides that the Executive Office must consult on the arrangements to be established and maintained by it under subsection (1) of that section.

title: The Registered Rents (Increase) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order increases the rents registered with the Rent Officer for Northern Ireland under Part IV of the Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006 during the period beginning on 2nd April 2007 and ending on 6th August 2023 by 7.0 percent.

title: The Hartlepool Development Corporation (Establishment) Order 2023
description: This Order establishes a corporation in relation to an area in the Tees Valley Combined Authority, designated as a Mayoral development area. The area is shown bounded externally by the inside edge of the black lines of the maps.

title: The Middlesbrough Development Corporation (Establishment) Order 2023
description: This Order establishes a corporation in relation to an area in the Tees Valley Combined Authority, designated as a Mayoral development area. The area is shown bounded externally by the inside edge of the black line of the map.

title: The Countryside and Rights of Way Act 2000 (Review of Maps) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations amend section 10(2) of the Countryside and Rights of Way Act 2000 (c. 37) (“the Act”) in relation to Wales.

title: The Industrial Training Levy (Construction Industry) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order gives effect to proposals submitted by the Construction Industry Training Board to the Department for the Economy for the imposition of a further levy upon employers in the construction industry for the purpose of raising money towards the expenses of the Board.

title: The Agriculture (Student Fees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: Section 5 of the Agriculture Act (Northern Ireland) 1949 (“the Act”) enables the Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs (“the Department”) to provide instruction in agriculture and related matters. Section 5A, which was added to the Act by way of amendment through the Education (Northern Ireland) Order 2006, provides that the Department may through regulations charge fees for or in connection with the provision of the aforementioned instruction.

title: The Social Security (Income and Capital Disregards) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Rule amends various social security Regulations to make provision for Post Office Horizon-related compensation payments, Grenfell Tower-related compensation and damages payments and Vaccine Damage Scheme payments to be disregarded indefinitely as capital and income for the purposes of calculating entitlement to benefit. Further provision is made to exempt Grenfell Tower-related payments and Post Office Horizon-related payments from the Department’s compensation recovery process.

title: The Social Security (Budgeting Loans) (Electronic Communications) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order amends the Social Security (Claims and Payments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987 (“the Claims and Payments Regulations”) to allow electronic claims to be made for budgeting loans.

title: The Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order amends the Planning (General Permitted Development) Order (Northern Ireland) 2015 (“the 2015 Order”).

title: The Social Security, Universal Credit and State Pension (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations make minor amendments to various social security and state pension regulations.

title: The Pensions Dashboards Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Universal Credit (Childcare) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Universal Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) (2016 S.R. No. 2016) (“the UC Regulations”).

title: The Whole of Government Accounts (Designation of Bodies) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order designates bodies, for the financial year ending with 31st March 2023, for the purposes of section 15 of the Government Resources and Accounts Act (Northern Ireland) 2001. The Department of Finance (“the Department”) intends to pass the information provided by bodies so designated in the Schedule to this Order to HM Treasury for use in the preparation of the Whole of Government Accounts (WGA). The designation enables the Department to require those bodies to provide financial information in relation to the year in question. The bodies designated include the District Councils for the 11 Local Government Districts established pursuant to the Local Government (Boundaries) Act (Northern Ireland) 2008.

title: The Justice (Sexual Offences and Trafficking Victims) (2022 Act) (Commencement No.1) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order brings section 28 of, and Schedule 4, except paragraphs 1(a) and 3(a), to the Justice (Sexual Offences and Trafficking Victims) Act (Northern Ireland) 2022 (“the Act”) into operation on 26th June 2023.

title: The Education (Student Finance) (Miscellaneous Amendments) (Wales) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations amend—the Education (Fees and Awards) (Wales) Regulations 2007 (“the 2007 Regulations”) (see Part 2 of the Regulations),the Education (European University Institute) (Wales) Regulations 2014 (“the 2014 Regulations”) (see Part 3 of the Regulations),the Higher Education (Qualifying Courses, Qualifying Persons and Supplementary Provision) (Wales) Regulations 2015 (“the 2015 Regulations”) (see Part 4 of the Regulations),the Education (Student Support) (Wales) Regulations 2017 (“the 2017 Regulations”) (see Part 5 of the Regulations),the Education (Student Support) (Wales) Regulations 2018 (“the 2018 Regulations”) (see Part 6 of the Regulations),the Education (Postgraduate Doctoral Degree Loans) (Wales) Regulations 2018 (“the Doctoral Degree Loan Regulations”) (see Part 7 of the Regulations), andthe Education (Student Support) (Postgraduate Master’s Degrees) (Wales) Regulations 2019 (“the 2019 Regulations”) (see Part 8 of the Regulations).

title: The Social Fund Maternity and Funeral Expenses (General) and Social Security (Claims and Payments) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: Regulation 2 of these Regulations amends the Social Security (Claims and Payments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987 (S.R. 1987 No. 465) to allow certain persons more time for claiming a Sure Start Maternity Grant (“SSMG”). The persons concerned are those who have been given leave to enter or remain in the United Kingdom having left—Afghanistan in connection with the fall of the Afghan Government; andUkraine following the Russian invasion of that country,

title: The Social Fund Winter Fuel Payment (Temporary Increase) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations modify the Social Fund Winter Fuel Payment Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2000 (S.R. 2000 No. 91) to provide for a temporary increase in winter fuel payments for the 2023-24 winter.

title: The National Health Service (Charges to Overseas Visitors) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations amend the National Health Service (Charges to Overseas Visitors) Regulations 1989 (S.I. 1989/306) (“the Principal Regulations”), which provide for the making and recovery of charges for relevant services provided under the National Health Service (Wales) Act 2006 (c. 42) to overseas visitors.

title: The Local Government Pension Scheme (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: The Local Government Pension Scheme Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2014 (“the 2014 Regulations”) established the Local Government Pension Scheme (“the Scheme”) as a career average revalued earnings scheme in accordance with section 8(2)(a) of the Public Service Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2014 (“the Act”).

title: The Social Security (Habitual Residence and Past Presence) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: Regulation 1 provides for citation and commencement.

title: The Allocation of Housing and Homelessness (Eligibility) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: Regulation 2 of these Regulations amends the Allocation of Housing and Homelessness (Eligibility) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006 (S.R. 2006/397) to ensure that persons who were residing in Sudan before 15th April 2023, and who left Sudan in connection with the violence which rapidly escalated on 15th April 2023 in Khartoum and across Sudan, are exempt from the habitual residence test otherwise applicable in relation to eligibility for an allocation of housing accommodation and for housing assistance.

title: The Local Government (Performance Indicators and Standards) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order amends the Local Government (Performance Indicators and Standards) Order (Northern Ireland) 2015 by updating Schedules 1 (economic development indicators) and 2 (economic development standards).

title: The Allocation of Housing and Homelessness (Eligibility) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Allcation of Housing and Homelessness (Eligibility) (Wales) Regulations 2014 (S.I. 2014/2603 (W. 257)) (“the 2014 Regulations”) which make provision for which persons subject to immigration control are eligible for an allocation of housing accommodation and for housing assistance.

title: The Betting, Gaming, Lotteries and Amusements (Amendment) (2022 Act) (Commencement No.1) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order is the first commencement order made under the Betting, Gaming, Lotteries and Amusements (Amendment) Act (Northern Ireland) 2022 (“the 2022 Act”). The Order brings into operation certain provisions of the 2022 Act which make amendments to the Betting, Gaming, Lotteries and Amusements (Northern Ireland) Order 1985 (“the 1985 Order”).

title: The Education (Student Fees, Awards and Support) (Amendment) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations amend various legislation which makes provision about, and in connection with student finance.

title: The Licensing (Form of Licence) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Licensing (Form of Licence) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1997, to take account of changes required to the form of licence as a result of provisions within the Licensing and Registration of Clubs (Amendment) Act (Northern Ireland) 2021. The relevant provisions authorise underage functions in specified licensed premises, further later opening for public houses and hotels, and the retail sale and consumption of intoxicating liquor in a local producer’s premises under the Licensing (Northern Ireland) Order 1996.

title: The Non-Domestic Rating (Multiplier) (Wales) Regulations 2023
description: In relation to Wales, the non-domestic rating multiplier is calculated in accordance with the formula in paragraph 4B of Schedule 7 to the Local Government Finance Act 1988 (“the 1988 Act”) for a financial year at the beginning of which new rating lists must be compiled. New rating lists are being compiled for the financial year beginning on 1 April 2023 (“the year concerned”).

title: The Road Traffic (Fixed Penalty) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order amends Schedule 1 to the Road Traffic (Fixed Penalty) Order (Northern Ireland) 2007 by inserting an amount of £100 for the fixed penalty prescribed for the offence under Article 12 of the Road Traffic (Northern Ireland) Order 1995.

title: The Road Traffic (Fixed Penalty) (Offences) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order amends Schedule 1 to the Road Traffic (Fixed Penalty) (Offences) Order (Northern Ireland) 1997 to specify an additional offence, relating to the driving of a mechanically propelled vehicle on a road or other public place without due care and attention, or without reasonable consideration for other persons using the road or place, to be a fixed penalty offence for the purposes of the Road Traffic Offenders (Northern Ireland) Order 1996.

title: The Local Government Finance (Scotland) Order 2023
description: This Order—determines the amount of the revenue support grant payable to each local authority in Scotland in respect of the financial year 2023-2024 (article 2 and schedule 1),determines the amount of non-domestic rate income to be distributed to each local authority in respect of that year (article 3 and schedule 1),redetermines the amount of the revenue support grant payable to each local authority in respect of the financial year 2022-2023 (article 4 and schedule 2), andmakes consequential revocations of article 2 and column 2 of schedule 1 of the Local Government Finance (Scotland) Order 2022, which previously determined the amount of revenue support grant payable to each local authority in respect of the financial year 2022-2023 (article 5).

title: The Crown Court (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Rules amend the Crown Court Rules (Northern Ireland) 1979 (S.R. 1979 No. 90) to:take account of amendments to section 9 of The Crime (Overseas Production Orders) Act 2019 (2019 c.5) made by section 51 of, and paragraph 4 of Schedule 5 to, the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Act 2022 (2022 c.32) which provide that an overseas production order shall be served on the Secretary of State or on a prescribed person (rule 2(1));amend rule 62P(3) (requirement for service) so that it is subject to rule 62Q(7)(c) (which grants the court a discretion to waive requirements for service) (rule 2(2)(a) – (d));provide for service of a varied overseas production order (rule 2(2)(e)); andprovide that a Court may determine an application for an overseas production order in the absence of any respondent or other person affected if it would prejudice the investigation to adjourn or postpone the application so as to allow the absentee to attend (rule 2(3)).

title: The Value Added Tax (Margin Schemes and Removal or Export of Goods: VAT-related Payments) Order 2023
description: This Order makes provision for a VAT-related payment to be made in respect of a relevant supply (“relevant supply”) of goods of a description specified in the Order. The Order specifies a relevant supply of a motor vehicle subject to certain conditions. This Order comes into force on 1st May 2023 and has effect in relation to goods removed to Northern Ireland or exported to the EU on or after that date.

title: The Social Security Benefits (Claims and Payments) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend paragraph 6 of Schedule 8A to the Social Security (Claims and Payments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987 (S.R. 1987 No. 465) (“the 1987 Regulations”) and paragraph 8 of Schedule 5 to the Universal Credit, Personal Independence Payment, Jobseeker’s Allowance and Employment and Support Allowance (Claims and Payments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2016 (S.R. 2016 No. 220) (“the 2016 Regulations”). These paragraphs contain provisions under which the Department for Communities may make deductions from benefit in respect of arrears for fuel costs and ongoing consumption of fuel to pay the fuel supplier directly.

title: The Community Care (Personal Care and Nursing Care) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2023 (revoked)
The Care and Support (Charging) and (Financial Assessment) (Wales) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Care and Support (Charging) (Wales) Regulations 2015 (“the Charging Regulations”) and the Care and Support (Financial Assessment) (Wales) Regulations 2015 (“the Financial Assessment Regulations”).

title: The Judicial Offices (Sitting in Retirement – Prescribed Offices and Descriptions) (Wales) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations are made in exercise of the powers conferred by section 124(3) and (4)(e) and 129(1)(b) of the Public Service Pensions and Judicial Offices Act 2022 in order to prescribe offices held by persons eligible to be appointed to a sitting in retirement office. These Regulations only apply to sitting in retirement offices where the appointing authority is the President of Welsh Tribunals.

title: The Police Service of Northern Ireland (Amendment) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Police Service of Northern Ireland Regulations 2005 and the Police Service of Northern Ireland and Police Service of Northern Ireland Reserve (Injury Benefit) Regulations 2006 to allow for the additional public holiday on 8th May 2023, to mark the coronation of His Majesty King Charles III.

title: The Judicial Pensions (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Judicial Pensions (Northern Ireland) Regulations 2015 (S.R. 2015 No. 76) (“the 2015 Regulations”).

title: The Control of Explosives Precursors and Poisons Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations concern the supply of regulated and reportable substances (see section 2 of the Poisons Act 1972 (c. 66) (“the 1972 Act”) for definitions of a regulated substance and a reportable substance).

title: The Occupational Pension Schemes (Administration, Investment, Charges and Governance) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Occupational Pension Schemes (Master Trusts) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Pensions Increase (Review) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: Under section 69 of the Social Security Pensions (Northern Ireland) Order 1975 (c.15), the Department of Finance has to provide, by Order, for the increase in the rates of public service pensions. The Pensions (Increase) Act (Northern Ireland) 1971 (c.35) defines certain terms and sets out when a pension “begins” (the day after the last day of service in respect of which the pension is payable) and how the increase applies to lump sums.

title: The Statutory Parental Bereavement Pay (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Parental Bereavement Leave and Pay (Consequential Amendments to Subordinate Legislation) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Parental Bereavement Leave Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Public Service Pensions Revaluation Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: Section 9 of the Public Service Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2014 (c.2) applies to pension schemes which, under that Act, require a revaluation of pensionable earnings, or a proportion of such earnings, accrued as a pension, by reference to a change in prices or earnings (or both) in a given period.

title: The Government Resources and Accounts (Northern Ireland) Act 2001 (Estimates and Accounts) (Designation of Bodies) Order 2023
description: This Order designates specified central government bodies in relation to named government departments for the purpose of those departments’ supply estimates and resource accounts.

title: The Occupational Pension Schemes (Governance and Registration) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Coronavirus Act 2020 (Extension of Provisions Relating to Local Authority Meetings) (No. 2) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: Section 78 of the Coronavirus Act 2020 (“the Act”) contains provision relating to Local Authority Meetings.

title: The Coronavirus Act 2020 (Extension of Powers to Act for the Protection of Public Health) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This order extends the expiry date of section 48 of, and Schedule 18 to, the Coronavirus Act 2020 to 24th September 2023.

title: The Scottish Landfill Tax (Standard Rate and Lower Rate) Order 2023 (revoked)
The Coronavirus Act 2020 (Registration of Deaths and Still-Births) (Extension) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: Section 18(3) of, and Part 3 of Schedule 13 to, the Coronavirus Act 2020 contain provisions relating to the registration of deaths and still-births in Northern Ireland.

title: The Coronavirus Act 2020 (Extension of Provisions Relating to Local Authority Meetings) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: Section 78 of the Coronavirus Act 2020 (“the Act”) contains provision relating to Local Authority Meetings.

title: The First-tier Tribunal for Scotland Local Taxation Chamber and Upper Tribunal for Scotland (Composition) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations make provision as to the composition of the First-tier Tribunal for Scotland when dealing with cases in the Local Taxation Chamber. They also make provision as to the composition of the Upper Tribunal for Scotland when dealing with cases appealed or referred from the Local Taxation Chamber.

title: The Council Tax Reduction Schemes (Prescribed Requirements and Default Scheme) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Council Tax Reduction Schemes and Prescribed Requirements (Wales) Regulations 2013 (“the Prescribed Requirements Regulations”) and the Council Tax Reduction Schemes (Default Scheme) (Wales) Regulations 2013 (“the Default Scheme Regulations”) made under section 13A(4) and (5) of, and Schedule 1B to, the Local Government Finance Act 1992 (“the 1992 Act”).

title: The Coronavirus Act 2020 (Extension of Provisions Relating to Live Links for Courts and Tribunals) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order extends the operation of the provisions in the Coronavirus Act 2020 (c. 7) which allow the wider and extended use of video or audio live links by all or any courts or a statutory tribunal (Part 1 of Schedule 27). It extends the provisions, which facilitate public participation in legal proceedings if, and when live links are used while protecting those proceedings from unauthorised recordings or transmission (Part 2 of Schedule 27).

title: The Social Security Benefits Up-rating Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Civil Legal Aid (Financial Resources and Payment for Services) (Amendment) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Civil Legal Aid (Financial Resources and Payment for Services) Regulations 2013 (S.I. 2013/480) (“the 2013 Regulations”).

title: The Mesothelioma Lump Sum Payments (Conditions and Amounts) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Social Security Benefits Up-rating Order (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Benefit Cap (Annual Limit) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Agricultural Holdings (Units of Production) (Wales) Order 2023
description: This Order prescribes units of production for the assessment of the productive capacity of agricultural land situated in Wales and sets out the amount which is to be regarded as the net annual income from each such unit for the periods 12 September 2021 to 11 September 2022 and 12 September 2022 to 11 September 2023, for certain purposes of the Agricultural Holdings Act 1986 (“the 1986 Act”).

title: The Pension Protection Fund (Compensation) and Occupational Pension Schemes (Fraud Compensation Payments) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Pension Protection Fund (Compensation) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005 and the Occupational Pension Schemes (Fraud Compensation Payments and Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005.

title: The Optical Charges and Payments (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations further amend the Health and Personal Social Services (Optical Charges and Payments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1997 (“the principal Regulations”) which provide for payment to be made, by means of a voucher system, in respect of costs incurred by certain categories of persons in connection with the supply, replacement and repair of optical appliances.

title: The Rate Relief (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations bring the Rate Relief Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2017 in line with universal credit rules in preparation for the managed migration of legacy benefit claimants to universal credit to ensure compatibility. The policy in relation to the impact of migration to UC on rate rebate has not changed. They also update cross-referencing within the regulations.

title: The Council Tax Reduction and Council Tax (Discounts) (Miscellaneous Amendment) (Scotland) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Council Tax Reduction (Scotland) Regulations 2021 (“the Working Age Regulations”), the Council Tax Reduction (State Pension Credit) (Scotland) Regulations 2012 (“the Pension Age Regulations”) and the Council Tax (Discounts) (Scotland) Regulations 1992. (“the Discount Regulations”).

title: The Planning (Fees) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Education (School Day and School Year) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2023
description: The Education (School Day and School Year) (Wales) Regulations 2003 (“the 2003 Regulations”) make provision about the length of the school day, which is ordinarily divided into two sessions with a break in the middle, and for schools to meet for at least 380 sessions during any school year.

title: The Employment Rights (Increase of Limits) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Social Security Revaluation of Earnings Factors Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order corresponds to an Order (S.I. 2023/266) made by the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions under section 148 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992. It directs that the earnings factors relevant to the calculation of additional pension in any long-term benefit (in practice, now relevant only to the calculation of inherited additional pension), or of any guaranteed minimum pension, or to any other calculation required under Part III of the Pension Schemes (Northern Ireland) Act 1993 are to be increased for the tax years specified in the Schedule to this Order by the percentage of their amount specified in that Schedule. This is to ensure that earnings factors for those years are revalued at 2022-2023 earnings levels.

title: The Health and Social Care Pension Scheme (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Health and Personal Social Services (Superannuation) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1995 (S.R 1995 No.95) (“the 1995 Regulations”), Health and Social Care (Pension Scheme) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008 (S.R. 2008 No.256) (“the 2008 regulations”), Health and Social Care Pension Scheme Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 (S.R. 2015 No.120) (“the 2015 Regulations”).

title: The Road Works (Reinstatement Quality Plans, Qualifications of Supervisors and Operatives and Miscellaneous Amendments) (Scotland) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations make provision about the reinstatement quality plans (“the plans”) to be entered into the Scottish Road Works Register (“the SRWR”) under section 130A or 130B of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991 (“the 1991 Act”).

title: The Recovery of Health Services Charges (Amounts) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: The Recovery of Health Services Charges (Northern Ireland) Order 2006 provides for a scheme for the recovery of charges in cases where an injured person who receives a compensation payment in respect of his injury has received hospital treatment or ambulance services. The charges are specified in certificates issued by the Department for Communities and are payable by persons who pay compensation to the injured person. The charges in each case are calculated by reference to a tariff of charges provided for by the Recovery of Health Services Charges (Amounts) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006 (“the principal Regulations”).

title: The Loans for Mortgage Interest (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Loans for Mortgage Interest Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2017 (“the 2017 Regulations”).

title: The Non-Domestic Rates (Transitional Relief) (Scotland) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations make provision as to the amount payable in certain circumstances as non-domestic rates in respect of non-domestic properties in Scotland. They apply to the financial year 2023-24. The Regulations cease to apply where a non-domestic property is shown in a merged, split or reorganised entry in the valuation roll which takes effect during the financial year 2023-24.

title: The Social Security (2022 Benefits Up-rating) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Non-Domestic Rates (Levying and Miscellaneous Amendment) (Scotland) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations make provision for the amount payable as non-domestic rates in certain circumstances in respect of certain non-domestic properties in Scotland. The non-domestic rate for properties not covered by these Regulations is fixed by Order made under the Local Government (Scotland) Act 1975. For the financial year 2023-2024, the rate is fixed by the Non-Domestic Rate (Scotland) Order 2023 (S.S.I. 2023/29).

title: The Guaranteed Minimum Pensions Increase Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order, which corresponds to an Order (S.I. 2023/270) made by the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions under section 109(4) of the Pension Schemes Act 1993, specifies 3 per cent. as the percentage by which that part of guaranteed minimum pensions attributable to earnings factors for the tax years 1988-1989 to 1996-1997, and payable by contracted-out, defined benefit occupational pension schemes, is to be increased.

title: The Mesothelioma Lump Sum Payments (2022 Conditions and Amounts) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations revoke and re-enact the provisions of the Mesothelioma Lump Sum Payments (Conditions and Amounts) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2022 which would otherwise cease to have effect by virtue of section 10(2) of the Mesothelioma, etc., Act (Northern Ireland) 2008. These Regulations amend the Mesothelioma Lump Sum Payments (Conditions and Amounts) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008 to increase amounts of lump sums payable to people with diffuse mesothelioma or to their dependants under the Mesothelioma, etc., Act (Northern Ireland) 2008. The increase in each case is 3.1 per cent., rounded up or down to the nearest £1 as appropriate.

title: The Non-Domestic Rates (Restriction of Relief) (Scotland) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations place conditions on the granting of certain relief from non-domestic rates to ensure that the granting of such relief is compatible with the Subsidy Control Act 2022 (“the 2022 Act”).

title: The Food Supplements and Food for Specific Groups (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations make provision in relation to vitamins and minerals permitted in the manufacture of food supplements and certain categories of food. Regulation 6(2)(b) corrects a copying error made in SI 2019/651. Following consultation with the SI Registrar, this instrument has been issued under the free issue procedure.

title: The Social Security (2022 Benefits Up-rating) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Human Tissue (Permitted Material) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations are made under the Human Tissue Act 2004 (c.30) (“the 2004 Act”). Section 3 of the 2004 Act makes provision for the interpretation of “appropriate consent”. This term is used in section 1 in relation to an activity involving the body, or material from the body, of a person who is an adult or has died an adult.

title: The Packaging Waste (Data Reporting) (No.2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations impose requirements on producers who are established in Northern Ireland to collect data on the packaging they supply to others, and, in some cases, to report some of that information to the Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs.

title: The Pension Protection Fund and Occupational Pension Schemes (Levy Ceiling) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Private Tenancies (2022 Act) (Commencement No.1) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order brings into operation certain provisions of the Private Tenancies Act (Northern Ireland) 2022 which make amendments to the Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006. These provisions relate to tenants being given notice of certain matters relating to a tenancy including past matters and being given receipts for any cash payment made in relation to a tenancy. The Order also brings into operation provisions relating to tenancy deposits. It provides that the amount of a tenancy deposit shall be no more than one month’s rent. In addition, it increases the time limits for requirements relating to tenancy deposits and provides that certain offences in connection with tenancy deposits shall be continuing offences.

title: The National Assistance (Sums for Personal Requirements) (Scotland) Regulations 2023 (revoked)
The Tenancy Information Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations set out the form of notice and information a landlord must give a tenant relating to the granting of a tenancy and any variation of that tenancy, within 28 days of such granting or such variation.

title: The National Assistance (Assessment of Resources) Amendment (Scotland) Regulations 2023 (revoked)
The Tenancy Deposit Schemes (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend regulation 12 paragraphs (a) and (b), regulation 37(2) and Schedule 1, paragraphs (1) and (3) of the Tenancy Deposit Schemes Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012 by increasing the time limits for requirements relating to tenancy deposits.

title: The Agricultural Holdings (Units of Production) (England) Order 2023 (revoked)
The Rehabilitation of Offenders (Exceptions) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order amends the Rehabilitation of Offenders (Exceptions) Order (Northern Ireland) 1979 (“the 1979 Order”) to bring individuals who are seeking to act as an adult placement carer in accordance with the Adult Placement Agencies Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007, within the excluded circumstances set out in Article 2 of the 1979 Order.

title: The Police Act 1997 (Criminal Records) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Police Act 1997 (Criminal Records) (Disclosure) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008 (“the 2008 Regulations”) to make provision for enhanced criminal record checks with suitability information in relation to individuals who are seeking to act as an adult placement carer in accordance with the Adult Placement Agencies Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007.

title: The Winter Heating Assistance (Low Income) (Scotland) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations make provision about payments of winter heating payment to certain individuals who are in receipt of specified low income benefits. Regulation 4 sets out the eligibility rules for winter heating payment. Regulations 5 to 8 make provision about matters of procedure for determining entitlement to winter heating payment. Regulations 9 and 10 provide for payments of winter heating payment. A Business Regulatory Impact Assessment has been prepared and placed in the Scottish Parliament Information Centre. Copies can be obtained from the Social Security Directorate, Scottish Government, Area 1B South, Victoria Quay, Edinburgh EH6 6QQ, and online at www.legislation.gov.uk.

title: The Insolvency (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Rules amend the Insolvency Rules (Northern Ireland) 1991 (S.R. 1991 No. 364) (“the principal Rules”) in connection with the introduction of the new moratorium procedure (“the moratorium”) in Part 1A of the Insolvency (Northern Ireland) Order 1989 (S.I. 1989/2405 (N.I. 19)) (“the 1989 Order”) and the repeal of Schedule A1 to that Order.

title: The Organ and Tissue Donation (Deemed Consent) (2022 Act) (Commencement) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Commencement Order is made by the Department of Health under section 2(2) of the Organ and Tissue Donation (Deemed Consent) Act (Northern Ireland) 2022 (“the Act”).

title: The Government of Wales Act 2006 (Budget Motions and Designated Bodies) (Amendment) Order 2023
description: This Order amends the Government of Wales Act 2006 (Budget Motions and Designated Bodies) Order 2018 (“the 2018 Order”). It inserts 4 additional bodies into the list of designated bodies contained within the Schedule to the 2018 Order.

title: The Guardians Ad Litem (Panel) (Revocation) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations revoke the Guardians Ad Litem (Panel) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996.

title: The Adoption and Children (2022 Act) (Commencement No. 1) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order brings into operation on 13th February 2023, section 137 of the Adoption and Children Act (Northern Ireland) 2022.

title: The Children’s Court Guardian Agency for Northern Ireland (Establishment and Constitution) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This order provides for the name of the Northern Ireland Guardian ad Litem Agency for Northern Ireland, which was established and constituted as a special health and social services agency under the Northern Ireland Guardian ad Litem Agency (Establishment and Constitution) Order (Northern Ireland) 1995, to be changed to the Children’s Court Guardian Agency for Northern Ireland.

title: The Level Crossing (Cullybackey Station) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order provides for the provision and maintenance of manually controlled barriers supervised by closed circuit television at Cullybackey Station Level Crossing. Section 47 of the Railways Clauses Consolidation Act 1845 (which requires the railway undertaking to provide gates and gate-keepers), section 6 of the Railways Clauses Act 1863 (requirements as to lodges, etc.) and any other statutory provision imposing requirements to the same or similar effect, shall not apply to the crossing whilst this Order remains in force.

title: The Energy Bills Support Scheme and Alternative Fuel Payment Pass-through Requirement (Northern Ireland) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations make provision for pass-through requirements in relation to the Energy Bills Support Scheme and Alternative Fuel Payment in Northern Ireland (EBSS AFP NI). Pass-through requirements are imposed on a “relevant intermediary” (defined in regulation 2) and establish that they must pass-through the benefits of the EBSS AFP NI scheme to an “end user” to whom energy has been made available (defined in section 19(3) of the Energy Prices Act 2022 (c. 44)) but excluding any person to whom a relevant intermediary supplies or makes available energy outside Northern Ireland. These Regulations apply in respect of relevant intermediaries other than those providing certain types of hospitality accommodation (defined as “excluded persons” under these Regulations).

title: The Level Crossing (Cullybackey North) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order provides for the provision and maintenance of manually controlled barriers supervised by closed circuit television at Cullybackey North Level Crossing. Section 47 of the Railways Clauses Consolidation Act 1845 (which requires the railway undertaking to provide gates and gate-keepers), section 6 of the Railways Clauses Act 1863 (requirements as to lodges, etc.) and any other statutory provision imposing requirements to the same or similar effect, shall not apply to the crossing whilst this Order remains in force.

title: The Energy Bill Relief Scheme (Non-Standard Cases) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations make provision about the Energy Bill Relief Scheme for Non-Standard Customers in Great Britain and Northern Ireland (“the Scheme”) by which the Secretary of State provides certain non-domestic customers with financial assistance to meet costs related to the use of electricity and gas. Assistance is provided under “scheme agreements”, that incorporate published “Scheme Terms”. Amongst other things, the Scheme Terms set out the criteria that customers, and the energy that they consume, must meet if they are to receive assistance.

title: The Level Crossing (Cullybackey South) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: This Order provides for the provision and maintenance of manually controlled barriers supervised by closed circuit television at Cullybackey South Level Crossing. Section 47 of the Railways Clauses Consolidation Act 1845 (which requires the railway undertaking to provide gates and gate-keepers), section 6 of the Railways Clauses Act 1863 (requirements as to lodges, etc.) and any other statutory provision imposing requirements to the same or similar effect, shall not apply to the crossing whilst this Order remains in force.

title: The Occupational Pension Schemes (Collective Money Purchase Schemes) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Packaging Waste (Data Reporting) (Scotland) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations impose requirements on producers who are established in Scotland to collect data on the packaging they supply to others, and, in some cases, to report some of that information to the Scottish Environment Protection Agency (SEPA).

title: The Packaging Waste (Data Reporting) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023 (revoked)
The Edible Crabs (Conservation) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend the Edible Crabs (Conservation) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2020 (the Principal Regulations) to prohibit the retention on board a sea-fishing boat, the bringing to land, the landing, having in possession, selling, exposing for sale, buying for sale, or consigning to any person for the purpose of sale, a soft-shelled edible crab. A soft-shelled edible crab brought on board a sea-fishing boat must be immediately returned to the sea.

title: The Housing Benefit and Universal Credit Housing Costs (Executive Determinations) (Modification) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations modify the Housing Benefit (Executive Determinations) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008 (S.R. 2008 No. 100) and the Universal Credit Housing Costs (Executive Determinations) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2016 (S.R. 2016 No. 222) to make changes to how the local housing allowance is determined.

title: The Universal Credit (Administrative Earnings Threshold) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations amend regulation 97 of the Universal Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2016 (S.R. 2016 No. 216), which sets out the circumstances in which work search and availability requirements may not be imposed on a universal credit claimant.

title: The Health Protection (Coronavirus, International Travel from China) (England) Regulations 2023
description: These Regulations introduce requirements in relation to people who arrive in England having boarded a flight that originated in the People’s Republic of China (excluding flights that originated from the Special Administrative Regions of Hong Kong or Macao). The Regulations relate to a requirement for such people to possess notification of a negative result from a test for SARS-CoV-2.

title: The Housing Renovation etc. Grants (Grant Limit) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: The Housing Renovation etc. Grants (Grant Limit) Order (Northern Ireland) 2003 makes provision in relation to the amount of housing grants that the Housing Executive may pay.

title: The Rates (Making and Levying of Different Rates) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2023
description: These Regulations replace the Rates (Making and Levying of Different Rates) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2022. These Regulations act to—enable different rates to be made and levied on the rateable net annual values of premises and the rateable capital values of premises (regulation 2 and 3);revoke the Rates (Making and Levying of Different Rates) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2022 with savings (regulation 4).
